#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tachileik
#Text=Tachileik ( also spelt Tachilek ) is in Shan State , Eastern Myanmar , on the border with Thailand .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Although just 5 m across the river from Mae Sai , the northernmost town in Thailand , Tachileik seems a different world .
#Text=The happy outgoing atmosphere that you have been used to in Thailand evaporates instantly and is replaced by a slightly uptight one .

#Text=This is not to say that the Burmese people are not welcoming , indeed they love tourists and are very keen to sit down and talk ( when they think they are not being watched ) , but do not expect to feel at ease here , and do not be surprised if you are followed by government people throughout the town .

#Text=As long as your purposes are legitimate , you follow local rules and customs and you do n't go around making a spectacle of yourself , you will have a great time in Tachileik and the border area of Burma .
#Text=The demeanour of the locals has lightened greatly since the advent of Myanmar 's fledgling democracy and much of the feeling of being watched has dissipated .
#Text=As of October 2017 the transformation in Tachilek has been remarkable .
#Text=Now it is Mae Sai that is a quiet backwater now that visa-runners have been banned and there are few tourists and Tachilek is now a fun place to spend the day .
#Text=Everyone from the immigration officials to local market traders has a sense of joie de vivre that did not exist even 3 or 4 years ago .

#Text=If anyone is watching anyone nowadays it is on the Thai side with officialdom watching over many aspects of peoples increasingly regulated lives whilst Tachilek has taken on the mantle of party town .
#Text=The majority of people crossing over to Myanmar are Thais shopping for bootlegged Chinese goods in the market .
#Text=Alternatively some Thais cross to play golf on the only course in the region , so expect to see the surreal sight of large groups of people crossing the border carrying sets of clubs .
#Text=There are also 3 casinos in Tachileik , one of which caters to " low " rollers .
#Text=You may even find a 10 baht roulette table .
#Text=There are very few foreigners making the crossing these days .
#Text=If you are expecting to see the real Myanmar , this is not the place to do it .

#Text=If you are " stamp collecting " in your passport , want to see something a bit more visceral than what you find in Thailand or are at loose ends in Chiang Rai for the day , then this is a good place to go .
#Text=A good thing about visiting is the ease of entry to the border area , getting another stamp in your passport and getting a flavour of life in Myanmar .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From Thailand
#Text=It 's possible to enter Myanmar at the Mae Sai border post .
#Text=A 14 day visa is USD10 or 500 baht .
#Text=Note , if your USD10 is not in pristine condition , the authorities will not accept it .
#Text=They really want 500 baht instead since it is worth USD16 .
#Text=As of October 2017 , $ 10 is readily accepted again and the notes no longer need to be pristine .
#Text=The visa is valid only for the Tachilek- Kengtung area and is not for travel to other parts of Myanmar .
#Text=Note , the Myanmar Immigration authorities will hold on to your passport for the duration of your stay in the country giving you an entry permit instead .
#Text=You will get your passport back on crossing back over to Thailand .
#Text=Holders of a normal one-month Myanmar visa cannot use it to enter at Mae Sai .
#Text=As of November 2017 , foreigners holding Myanmar e-visas can enter the country at Tachilek .

#Text=Ensure you have the appropriate travel documents to re-enter Thailand at Mae Sai , you will only be able to get a 15 day entry pass into Thailand rather than the usual 30 day one that you get at the airport .
#Text=If you have a visa and want to keep it , remember to get a re-entry permit in advance .
#Text=As of July 2016 even 15 day entry
#Text=Thai entry stamps are not being issued and a large sign at the border stresses that the crossing cannot be used by visa-runners .
#Text=If you are a Thai citizen , you can get a temporary border pass at the Immigration office about 2 km before the border on Pahonyotin Rd in Mae Sai for 30 baht .
#Text=All you need is your bat prachachon ( ID card ) .
#Text=By air
#Text=Air Bagan and Yangon Airways fly to Heho via Kengtung daily .
#Text=Air Mandalay offers a non-stop flight to Mandalay .
#Text=All have connecting or continuing service to Yangon and other parts of Myanmar .
#Text=By road
#Text=Shared taxis ( USD12 ) and buses ( USD8 ) run to Kengtung ( 4-5 hr ) in the mornings .
#Text=A permit is necessary but bus and taxi drivers can make the arrangements ( do n't show up at the last minute ) .
#Text=Onward travel from Kengtung to Mong La on the Chinese border is possible with permission from Myanmar immigration , easily organised in Kengtung .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Tachilek is small and there are plenty of trishaws for hire .
#Text=Motorcycle taxis and car taxis are also available .
#Text=The bus station and airport are outside town on the road to Kengtung .
#Text=Take a pickup or hire a taxi to get there .
#Text=See
#Text=Market .
#Text=The local market , populated by vendors from villages near and far , is worth a visit .
#Text=The market closes in mid-morning .
#Text=A second market caters to day tourists from Thailand .
#Text=Shwedagon Paya .
#Text=The main pagoda in town , it is large and gilded .
#Text=Not to be confused with its namesake in Yangon .
#Text=Do
#Text=Regina Casino .
#Text=Try your luck here , a short 100 baht tuk-tuk ride from the border .
#Text=They 're the same people who own the golf course .
#Text=Definitely for low rollers , you can play roulette with 10 baht chips .
#Text=They 've also got blackjack , craps and gaming machines .
#Text=If you change 2,000 baht into chips you get a free Thai lunch .
#Text=You can change remaining chips afterwards .
#Text=A casino minibus will take you back to the border .
